item.title: Building v14 on dedicated hardware
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
We don’t have specifically for Whonix. Why? See:

Whonix

Dev/Automatic Updates

Why does Whonix (not) use Automatic Updates? Why does Whonix (not) use a GUI Update Notifier or GUI Updater?

Since Whonix is based on Debian, you can use the auto upgrade mechanisms available by Debian as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle. This is as long as there is no Whonix release upgrade (14 -> 15).

item.title: Building v14 on dedicated hardware
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
brothermother:

Error --target must be either virtualbox, qcow2, raw or root and can be used multiple times.

--target root

brothermother:

As for apt-get failure, do I need both eth0 and eth1 for whonix_build to complete?

I don’t think so.

./whonix_build --flavor whonix-gateway -- --target this syntax is deprecated in Whonix 14 btw.

Try.

sudo ./whonix_build --flavor whonix-gateway --target root --build

Longer log excerpt required. Specifically the part where apt-get failed.

brothermother:

anon_dist_build_version:

Which tag did you use?

Make sure you did https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Build_Documentation/Physical_Isolation#Choose_Version right.

And yes. Don’t bother with Whonix 13 since 14 release is very very close.
